page.title: 16The Heywood Fire Service.
page.content: Jason Harrison writes: The{Heywood Fire Station}is the nearest station to the{M62.}It has the best trained men and equipment for {motorway accidents.}They have two general purpose fire engines and a special landrover which is used in motorway accidents, mostly for{rescue} purposes. It has a winch, saws, drills, and first aid equipment. It also has a 20ft telescopic stem light which makes it as light as day in a 30ft radius around the landrover. All the tools in the landrover are run by electricity, manual power, pneumatic or hydraulic power. On the motorway firemen have a lot of power, they can drive up embankments or drive the wrong way and do U-turns, if the situation calls for these actions. Their biggest problems are lack of water and exposure.
